Sentence.sentence: About once a week, I have a client that will bring up a new certification I've never even heard of and I'm in this industry, said Kevin Wilhelm, chief executive officer of Sustainable Business Consulting.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: You can see that we're here to stay, said Vladimir Cheberdak, 57, chief of the Bellingshausen Station, as he sipped tea under a portrait of Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen, a high-ranking officer in the Imperial Russian Navy who explored the Antarctic coast in 1820.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many admissions officers say they spend less than a couple of minutes on each application, including the essay.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The University of Maryland at College Park is proceeding cautiously, giving the iPhone or iPod Touch to 150 students, said Jeffrey Huskamp, vice president and chief information officer at the university.

Sentence.sentence: "About once a week, I have a client that will bring up a new certification I've never even heard of and I'm in this industry," said Kevin wilhelm, chief executive officer of Sustainable Business Consulting.

Sentence.sentence: Sara Greenstein, Underwriters Laboratories' chief strategy officer, offered her interpretation of the survey results, "Innovation is too fast only if corners are cut.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"官员"之意。
means: officer ： 主要指军官或警官，有时也的指文职官员或高级职员。
official ： 通常指文职官员，公职人员。有时也指军官或警官。

Sentence.sentence: Shackleton, a onetime British merchant-navy officer who had got to within 100 miles of the south pole in 1908, started a business before his 1914 voyage to make money from movie and still photography.

Sentence.sentence: We have such roles as project managers, mountain leaders, and communication officers.

sentences.en: He dreamed to be an officer.
sentences.cn: 在梦中他成了一名军官。

means.word_mean: (政府, 会社等的)高级官员[职员]

sentences.en: Her husband was a customs officer.
sentences.cn: 她的丈夫是一名海关官员。

entry.def: In the armed forces, an officer is a person in a position of authority.

example.ex: Her husband served during the Civil War as an officer in the White Army.
example.tran: 她的丈夫在内战时期是一名白军的军官。

entry.def: An officer is a person who has a responsible position in an organization, especially a government organization.
entry.tran: （机构的）高级职员；（尤指政府机构的）官员，公务员

entry.def: Members of the police force can be referred to as officers .

example.ex: ...senior officers in the West Midlands police force...
example.tran: 西米德兰兹郡警队的高级警官

means.word_mean: 1. any person in the armed services who holds a position of authority or command;

sentences.sentence: "an officer is responsible for the lives of his men"

means.word_mean: 2. someone who is appointed or elected to an office and who holds a position of trust;

sentences.sentence: "he is an officer of the court"
"the club elected its officers for the coming year"

means.word_mean: 3. a member of a police force;
4. a person authorized to serve in a position of authority on a vessel;

sentences.sentence: "he is the officer in charge of the ship's engines"

means.word_mean: 1. direct or command as an officer

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Anglo-Norman French from medieval Latin officiarius, from Latin officium (see office)

sentences.en: The officers took over and forced his abdication in 1947.

sentences.en: The officer gave the order to stand easy.

sentences.cn: 军官们互致敬礼.
sentences.en: The officers exchanged salutes.

sentences.cn: 敷衍的内部调查迅速指向德雷福斯 —— 唯一的犹太见习军官.
sentences.en: A perfunctory internal investigation swiftly fingered Dreyfus , the only Jewish trainee officer on the General Staff.

sentences.cn: 那军官承认这是一辆美国制造的坦克.
sentences.en: The officer allowed that it was an American tank.

sentences.cn: 士兵们遵照上级军官的命令行动.
sentences.en: Soldiers act in obedience to the orders of their superior officers.

sentences.cn: 布罗迪已在海滩安排了两名军官.
sentences.en: Brody had posted two officers on the beach.

sentences.cn: 将军把所有的军官召集在一起.
sentences.en: The general summoned all his officers.

sentences.cn: 一些军官到场,设法恢复秩序.
sentences.en: Some officers appeared and tried to restore order.

sentences.cn: 士兵向军官敬礼.
sentences.en: The soldier saluted the officer.

sentences.cn: 他们和军官密谋,以图推翻政府.
sentences.en: They plotted with the army officers to overthrow the government.

sentences.cn: 军官发出了不容许辩驳的命令.
sentences.en: The officer issued peremptory commands.

sentences.cn: 他听到一个军官在命令其他的士兵射击.
sentences.en: He heard an officer call to the other soldiers to shoot.

sentences.cn: 每位军官都要干几年巡逻的活儿.
sentences.en: Every officer spent some years on the beat.

sentences.cn: 对下级军官他一味采取威逼的手段,压着他们多做工作.
sentences.en: He consistently bullied his junior officers to produce more work.

sentences.cn: 士兵们向军官举手敬礼.
sentences.en: The soldiers salute the officer.

sentences.cn: 你是兵营军官?
sentences.en: You the Barrack Officer?

sentences.cn: 军官得到了冰冻米的好价钱.
sentences.en: A nice price of the iced rice is offered tob the officer.

sentences.cn: 一个军衔高于少校低于上校的委任的海军军官.
sentences.en: A commissioned officer in the British and Canadian navies ranking just below a lieutenant commander.

sentences.cn: 西点军校是一所培养未来军官的院校.
sentences.en: West Piont Point is a college for future army Army officers.

sentences.en: McCain briskly walks up to salute and shake hands with U.S. military officers.

sentences.en: In barracks all the officers of a battalion mess together.

sentences.cn: 所有的房间都有私人浴室.
sentences.en: All rooms have a private bath.

sentences.cn: 喂, 警官, 为什么前面不让走了?
sentences.en: Hello, officer. Why is this road closed?

sentences.cn: 史密斯警官: 有时候一想到身边可能随时出现歹徒, 我就很害怕.
sentences.en: Officer Smith: Sometimes I think there might be criminals around, and I get very scared.

sentences.cn: 警官, 请恕我打搅一下.
sentences.en: Officer, give me a break.

sentences.cn: 警官,他思想没有开小差.
sentences.en: He wasn't dreaming, officer.

sentences.cn: 警官! 我的包被抢了!
sentences.en: Officer ! Someone stole my purse!

sentences.en: One of the police officers was hacked to death by the mob.

sentences.cn: 他是负责调查的警官.
sentences.en: He was the officer in charge of the investigation.

sentences.cn: 九名警官匆匆进入他的房子.
sentences.en: Nine officers burst into his house.

sentences.cn: 警官: 我还要给你张传票,你没系安全带.
sentences.en: Officer: I'm also going to give you a citation for not wearing your seat belt.

sentences.cn: 杰奥杰甚至给我配备了一个保镖, 是一个穿着时尚的便衣的女警官,她的名字叫阿妮克·奥盖尔.
sentences.en: Gyorgy has even assigned me a bodyguard, a chic plainclothes female officer named Aniko Ongar.

sentences.cn: 一名犹他州的警官称他监控到一名司机驾驶丰田车时速达到95.
sentences.en: A Utah police officer says he clocked the driver of this Toyota doing 95.

sentences.cn: 负责这件案子的警官是警长刘易斯.
sentences.en: The officer in charge of the case is Superintendent Lewis.

sentences.cn: 维克多: 托勒斯警官, 我的朋友说你是留种的雄兽.
sentences.en: Viktor Navorski: Officer Torres, my friend say you are stallion.

sentences.cn: 有个警官来到现场调查情况.
sentences.en: A police officer came on the scene to search into the circumstances.

sentences.cn: 他就是差劲警官的样板.
sentences.en: He was a poor apology for a police officer.

sentences.cn: 一看见那些警官,他们便逃跑了.
sentences.en: At the sight of the police officers they ran off.

sentences.cn: 警官已经驻守在这个建筑物的全部出口.
sentences.en: Police officers had stationed themselves at all the entrances to the building.

sentences.cn: 你想当医生 、 教师或警官 吗 ?
sentences.en: You want to be a doctor, or a teacher, or a police officer?

sentences.cn: 警官把所有的警察都召集了起来.
sentences.en: The officer called all the policemen together.

sentences.cn: 小偷们都跑了,这让警官们很丢脸.
sentences.en: The police officers had eggs on their faces after the thieves got away.

sentences.cn: 他需要向警察局长就他警力中警官的行为进行解释.
sentences.en: He is answerable to the police commissioner for the conduct of the officer in his force.

sentences.cn: 我们会有便衣警官时刻守护着你.
sentences.en: We'll have undercover officers watching all the time.

sentences.cn: 他信步走到警官跟前问路.
sentences.en: He breezed up to the police officer asked for directions.

sentences.cn: 尼克横穿马路要到轻轨站, 被一位警官看到了.
sentences.en: Nick jaywalks to get to the MRT station. A police officer sees him.

sentences.cn: 来自日本的银行家堀田达夫正在与英格兰银行的一位高级职员闲谈.
sentences.en: Tatsuo Horita , a banker from Japan , is visiting with an officer of the Bank of England.

sentences.cn: 在正常情况下,公司高级职员的工资待遇由董事决定.
sentences.en: The directors normally determine the salaries of the officers of the corporation.

sentences.cn: 由于高级职员是公司的代理人, 他们有权约束公司.
sentences.en: Because officers are agents of the corporation, they have authority to bind the corporation.

sentences.cn: 他父亲是那家银行的高级职员.
sentences.en: His father was a senior officer at the bank.

sentences.cn: 公司高级职员还有约束公司的表见的权力.
sentences.en: Corporate officers may have apparent authority to bind the corporation.

sentences.cn: 瞧, 他要什么就会有什么. 他得宠于公司的一位高级职员.
sentences.en: Oh, he'll get what he wants. He has an in with one of the officers of the company.

sentences.cn: 银行遭受损失,而它的高级职员们却得到好处.
sentences.en: The bank suffers while its officers benefit.

sentences.cn: 任免高级职员是董事会的一项重要的管理职能.
sentences.en: The selection or removal of officers is an important managerial function of the board of directors.

sentences.cn: 最好的办法是到银行来,同我们这里负责贴现的高级职员谈谈.
sentences.en: C; Well , the best thing is to come in and talk with our discount officer.

sentences.cn: 通常,董事会任命高级职员, 高级职员根据董事会的要求执行职务.
sentences.en: The board ordinarily appoints the officers, who serve at the will of the directors.

sentences.cn: 要估算出究竟多少高级职员参与了怠工是不可能的。
sentences.en: It's impossible to assess how many officers are participating in the slowdown.

sentences.cn: 没有, 他们有些是公务员, 有些是工人.
sentences.en: No, some of them are officers, and some of them are workers.

sentences.cn: 我是一艘船的船长.
sentences.en: I'm chief officer on a ship.

sentences.cn: 我是在考虑从大副到船长的一系列职务.
sentences.en: I was thinking more on the lines of First Officer to Captain Valentine.

sentences.cn: 船长要他的职员小心预防, 因为水手们正在酝酿阴谋.
sentences.en: The captain asked his officers to take precautions, because a plot was brewing among the sailors.

sentences.cn: 海关官员: 我们现在开始工作吧, 船长.
sentences.en: Customs Officer: Les us start working now, Captain.

sentences.cn: 他是负责海船引擎的船长.
sentences.en: He is the officer in charge of the ship's engines.

sentences.cn: 船长决定哪怕是对高级船员也要封锁这个可怕的消息。
sentences.en: The captain decided to withhold the terrible news even from his officers.

sentences.cn: 这家人曾向船长正式投诉过，在航海日志里有记录。
sentences.en: The family made an official complaint to a ship's officer, which was recorded in the log.

sentences.cn: 作为你的指挥官，这件事转到了我这里。
sentences.en: The matter was passed on to me, as your commanding officer .

sentences.cn: 我明白这是在处罚我反对指挥官.
sentences.en: I know this to be a reproach for my having antagonized the commanding officer.

sentences.cn: 指挥官推荐威廉斯中士获勇敢勋章.
sentences.en: The commanding officer put Sergeant Williams in for a medal for bravery.

sentences.cn: 指挥官高声发出命令.
sentences.en: The commanding officer shouted his orders.

sentences.cn: 这条情报会交给指挥官,以让他批准.
sentences.en: The piece of intelligence will be handed over to the commanding officer for his approval.

sentences.cn: 我会说假装指挥官是由于在森林中得了神经病.
sentences.en: I'll say I impersonated an officer because I went crazy in the jungle.

sentences.cn: 作战时, 指挥官飞快地舞动着指挥刀.
sentences.en: While fighting, the commanding officer is quickly waving his officer's sword.

sentences.cn: 指挥官要下属绝对服从.
sentences.en: The commanding officer expected unquestioning obedience from his men.

sentences.cn: 指挥官派他去与敌人谈判交换战俘事宜.
sentences.en: The officer sent him to parley with the enemy for an exchange of prisoners.

sentences.cn: 当他(艾文·约克)所属排蒙受重大伤亡并且有三位士官已列入伤亡之后, 约克下士承担起指挥职务.
sentences.en: After his platoon suffered heavy casualties and noncommissioned officers had become casualties, Cpl. York assumed command.

sentences.cn: 新指挥官将该连加以整顿.
sentences.en: The new comanding officer put the company to rights.

sentences.cn: 这篇日志将重点讨论科技并且涉及一点部队中层指挥员.
sentences.en: The focus of this dev diary will be party on technology and partly on officers.

sentences.cn: 在本次军事演习中, 将校们在指挥室指挥作战.
sentences.en: During this military exercise, high ranking officers commanded the battle from the command room.

sentences.cn: 警察临时将两名路人找来协助指挥交通.
sentences.en: The police officer pressed two passersby into service to warn off traffic.

sentences.cn: 军官指挥士兵前进.
sentences.en: The officer waved his men to advance.

sentences.cn: 指挥官不在场, 我主动见机行事.
sentences.en: In the absence of my commanding officer, I acted on my own initiative.

sentences.cn: 那个家伙是我遇过的最差的指挥官.
sentences.en: That man is the worst commanding officer I've ever come across.

sentences.cn: 好心的指挥官延长了我的假期.
sentences.en: My vocation was extended by sympathetic commanding officer.

sentences.cn: 军官们指挥在前,并根据不断变化的环境作相应调整.
sentences.en: Commissioned officers lead from the front and adjust to environments that are always changing.

sentences.cn: 遵守所有的路标和交通警察的指挥.
sentences.en: Obey all road signs and police officers.

sentences.cn: 你要离开军营,就得请求指挥官特许.
sentences.en: You have to go to the commanding officer for special permission to leave the camp.
